attributes.action: Restrict the usage of fireworks to a 2 hour time slot (6-8pm or 7-9pm)
attributes.background: The law in the UK currently states that you may not set off fireworks between 11pm and 7am, except for Diwali, New Year and Chinese New Year, when it's 1am. Requesting a change from these hours to a reasonable 2 hour time slot will help people with young families and pets during this time.
attributes.additional_details:
Built up areas/residential areas: The sound of multiple displays up until 11pm/1am can be deafening as the bangs reverberate off buildings and wake sleeping children/stress out pets.
Fireworks have a 120 db sound limit: This is the same as a thunderclap. With multiple fireworks going off simultaneously and sounding like a thunderstorm for up to 5/7 hours straight, this can be extremely frightening for young children, babies and pets, as well as the elderly and any servicemen and women with PTSD.

attributes.action: Allow young people with 'controlled/managed' Asthma to join the Army.
attributes.background: Thousands of honest, dedicated young people have been denied recruitment to the Army simply for being diagnosed Asthmatic. Many young people who are physically fit and mentally capable are still being unfairly refused enrolment for receiving preventative treatment which keeps Asthma symptoms at bay
attributes.additional_details: Asthma is a life long condition that in many cases can be controlled/managed to the point where the sufferers symptoms have no effect on their daily life and activities. Thousands of young people are being unfairly denied the chance to defend their country and build themselves a solid and secure future simply because they receive preventative medication which keeps their Asthma symptoms at bay. This is unfair and outdated!

attributes.action: Tax on Premier League transfers to install and maintain free to use 4G pitches.
attributes.background: Introduce a tax on all Premier league transfers to raise funds to install and maintain 4G pitches in as many towns in England/Wales as possible that are free for kids/sports clubs/schools etc to use. Many children throughout England and Wales have to play football on inadequate pitches.
attributes.additional_details: Many football pitches are (water logged/on a hill/dangerous/ridden with dog muck) despite there being record breaking amounts of money in the English Premier league. £1.165bn spent to date this season already. Health of kids would increase from these pitches as would anti-social behaviour in communities. National football team would benefit as more children given opportunity to play on 'fit for purpose' pitches and fulfill their potential.

attributes.action: Ban Kirpans (ceremonial dagger) in primary schools
attributes.background: My children's primary school has just announced that they have passed a policy allowing children (aged 4 upwards) to wear a Kirpan if they have taken promises under Amrit.
attributes.additional_details: To me, a dagger is a dagger and has absolutely no place in a primary school.  I would like to see the Goverment review the situation and bring a complete ban on Kirpans in primary schools, as despite the policies in place, I do not feel happy allowing my children to be in an environment where other children are carrying daggers or knives.

attributes.action: Move the Houses of Parliament to Birmingham.
attributes.background: Houses of Parliament restoration work is estimated to cost £4 billion. We propose a new building on the outskirts of Birmingham near to the Airport and Exhibition Centre. A geographically central home in our second city would be created for Parliament and would provide excellent transport links.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: To cease Brexit negotiations until there is a drop in racially motivated crimes.
attributes.background: Racially motivated crimes appear to have increased in this country. The Government need to halt all Brexit negotiations until there is a substantial drop in racial and xenophobic hate crimes and issue an immediate statement of 'zero tolerance'

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf

attributes.action: Help create an international fund to counteract the U.S. 'global gag rule'.
attributes.background: The new U.S. President has reinstated legislation which threatens U.S.-funded aid organisations with withdrawal of funding should they offer women abortions or advocate abortion rights. The right to bodily autonomy is a fundamental human right and we must not allow it to be threatened.
attributes.additional_details: Marie Stopes International estimates that the loss of their services alone could lead to 6.5m unintended pregnancies, 2.1m unsafe abortions, and 21,700 maternal deaths. We call upon HM Government to increase its foreign health aid commitments and help mitigate the devastating impact of this legislation. The Dutch government has already launched plans for an international fund and we ask that the U.K. to contribute to this effort, and so help defend the rights of millions of vulnerable women.

attributes.action: Prisons should train operational support grades at C&R basic level.
attributes.background:
OSG are uniformed members of prison staff that are not legally entitled to take action to stop rioting if it breaks out among inmates and are not legally able to carry out "control and restraint" techniques.
In the event of aggressive behaviour the OSG are not allowed to lay hands on the inmate.
attributes.additional_details:
According to section 3 of NOMS-POA talk 1st Dec 16 OSG’s are not eligible for the reduction in retirement age as they are not in prisoner-facing roles, when infact we can be outside with over 200 prisoners  at a time, visits or even reception are also common areas for OSG to have prisoner contact.
I believe all establishments have a serious deficit by not of training OSG at C&R basic level,The lack of training is an indication of the Prison Service's lack of concern for the safety of staff

attributes.action: Make the government provide the funding that the NHS and social care need
attributes.background: The NHS and social care under the conservatives has taken huge cuts. This has put huge strain on the NHS with the Red Cross deeming it a "humanitarian crisis". People are dying waiting on trolleys in hospital for beds that are not available.
attributes.additional_details: People are waiting up to 12 hours to be seen in A&E, when the target is four hours. Old people spend weeks in hospital beds as there is no social care to treat them at home. People's lives are at risk and the conservative government are doing nothing about it. I hearby call that PM Theresa May and health secretary Jeremy Hunt provide the funding that is desperately needed. This demands action and it needs it now. We cannot put people's lives at risk, this is not acceptable. They must act now.

attributes.action: Suspend hospital fines for breaches in 4h waits in Emergency Departments
attributes.background: The Standard Contract for NHS Providers in 2015-16 charges hospitals £120 for every breach of the 4h wait times over the target in Emergency Departments. With unprecedented pressure on Emergency Departments currently this is an absurd system of punishing hospitals for being busy.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Health Committee "Winter pressure in accident and emergency departments Third Report of Session 2016–17" demonstrates that compliance with 4h targets plummets every winter (85% in 2015, 80% in 2016) and demand is currently higher than ever. Hospitals are paying the price of chronic government underfunding of Primary Care and Community Care, and to financially penalise hospitals for flawed government policy is clearly absurd.

attributes.action: The UK Government must commit to publicly destroying all stockpiled ivory.
attributes.background: Between 2009 and 2014, 40% of all illegal wildlife seizures made by the UK’s Border Force were ivory items. In 2015, 110kg of ivory were captured at Heathrow airport in one of the UK’s largest seizures of illegal ivory. We call on the UK Government to commit to destroying any stockpiles of ivory.
attributes.additional_details: Publicly destroying ivory stockpiles will raise awareness that the $20bn annual illegal wildlife trade is the 4th largest global illegal activity. This action will send a clear message to the world that the UK will not tolerate illegal trafficking and commercial trade in any raw or worked ivory and that we support a near total ban on domestic ivory trade. Most importantly, it will emphasise to current and future generations that ivory is worthless unless it is on wild living elephants.

attributes.action: I want  to create a law to neuter domestic pets except for registered breeders.
attributes.background: Hundreds and thousands of pet animals are slaughtered as there are not enough homes. I have volunteered in pet rescue for  years and its now  worse as peoples lifestyle and priorities in 21st century have changed. Cruelty and neglect are commonplace. Reduce the numbers humanely stop them being born.
attributes.additional_details: Rescue centres are being swamped with unwanted pets They are turning away animals that vets are having to destroy just because they are no longer wanted or cannot be afforded  A law that all domestic animals are neutered unless bred by legislated breeders could stop the puppy farms, and cruelty and neglect by ignorance and greed of casual breeding, and these innocent creatures of all ages could have loving homes  Check the websites of animal charities to see the levels of neglect and euthanasia

attributes.action: Cost to be cut in family courts.
attributes.background: During court processing through the family court over residency of child/ren between an applicant father and the respondent mother. If Cafcass orders a section 7 report and these findings prove the mother has abused her child/ren, cost should be cut for the fathers, to help protect their children.
attributes.additional_details: To many fathers these days have to apply to the family court to either receive some sort of access to their children, or in worse cases to try protect their children from abuse from the mothers. If mothers are found to be abusing their children in anyway and the fathers are to be awarded full residency of the child/ren then they should receive some sort of legal aid or cut the cost of the fees. It's wrong that anyone should have to pay thousands of pounds to save or protect a child/ren

attributes.action: Stop Immigration Skills Surcharge for the sake of our UK healthcare system
attributes.background: The Home Office are planning to charge £1000 per worker, per year to every employer who recruits an overseas worker. Our healthcare system is in crisis and with additional financial constraints such as this surcharge will see our healthcare system in even more trouble.
attributes.additional_details: As a country we are thousands of nurses short. The cost of overseas recruitment of highly skilled nurses is already a huge cost to our NHS and private sector. Additional surcharges will hinder the affordability of recruiting desperately needed staff. The Government have suggested this will aid UK employers to train and recruit british staff. Students are not choosing nursing as a career path due to many factors. Without highly skilled nurses, lives are increasingly at risk!

attributes.action: Make all care homes/care providers not for profit organisations
attributes.background: After many documentaries about undignified/unsafe  inadequate care homes, we need to do something. Most homes/services are understaffed under trained and underpaid due to the owners/providers wanting high profits. And the people that suffer are the residents/clients.
attributes.additional_details:
Panorama documentaries 
Cqc reports 
I have personally worked in care for many years and have experiences the poor quality first hand. It's about the time the government does something about it.

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Remove Prescription Charges for Long-Term Physical/Mental Health Conditions
attributes.background:
In England you pay for prescriptions, unless you have an illness from a special list, or meet other criteria (eg age or max income/assets). This list was set in the 60s; cancer is the only new addition.

We call for those with illnesses lasting 6+ months to get free prescriptions for that illness.
attributes.additional_details:
Around 800,000 people skimp on medication for cost reasons (IPSOS MORI). This raises overall NHS costs. E.g. the cost of an A&E visit for worse asthma exceeds the cost of the drugs. The regime is unfair & out of date, leaving many risking their health.

Further reading: 	
- Gilmore Report: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/prescription-charges-review-the-gilmore-report
- https://www.asthma.org.uk/get-involved/campaigns/our-policy-work/prescription-charges
- http://bit.ly/prescharges

attributes.action: Scrap fees for renunciation of all types of British nationalities.
attributes.background: British nationals who want to retain EU citizenship, because they live abroad or have direct links with other EU states, some will be forced to give up their British citizenship as some EU countries don't allow dual nationality. This is a hurtful decision and the UK must not take money away from us.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fees-for-citizenship-applications

attributes.action: Raise awareness and put more funding into treating and diagnosing VGM.
attributes.background: My little boy was repeatedly failed by numerous of consultants, doctors and hospitals after being diagnosed with Vein of Galen malformation. This was purely due to the lack of knowledge and understanding of the condition. We're counting our lucky stars he finally got treatment before it was too late
attributes.additional_details:
This condition is deadly. A ticking time bomb in your head. It's diagnosed in pregnancy and is where a mass forms in the brain putting strain on the heart to provide this mass with more blood. So many children die because either because it's too late to treat them or because of complications. 
This needs to stop! 
I nearly lost my little boy and I won't sit and watch it happen to any other parent. 
Money needs to be invested in helping doctors diagnose and treat children before it's too late.

attributes.action: Screening and training for mobility scooters especially for class 3
attributes.background: There are 300,000 mobility users in England and Wales. There were 208 accidents in 2014-2015, 46 serious injuries, and 9 deaths. Class 3 mobility scooters can use the road up to 8mph, need TAX and at present, only voluntary insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
Training is needed for cars and motorcycles that use the highways but no training is needed for mobility scooters. AM Hefin David and AM Julie Morgan are in agreement that training should be given. Compulsory training will help reduce accident rates and make the users more confident and independent which will help with well-being. Statistics are being looked into to make insurance mandatory but not training. ROSPA say training should be given but not necessary!

Screening should also be done by a doctor or medical professional before buying a mobility scooter. This will ensure that people have the physical and mental capacity required to safely use a scooter, such as adequate vision.

attributes.action: Free childcare for parents who want to return to work , child is 4 months +
attributes.background: I think parents who want to return to work and can't afford childcare should have free childcare provided or help with at least 30 hours a week.
attributes.additional_details: Childcare can be expensive and many parents find working a full week only pays childcare fees, this leeds to many parents quitting jobs to try and save some money.

attributes.action: Stop paying non uk citizens any benifits
attributes.background: If we stop paying benifits. Some migrants will leave of there own accord. Some might stop trying to come to the UK

attributes.action: Review cases of women needing breast reduction on medical grounds, not cosmetic
attributes.background:
Many women are being refused breast reduction on NHS because it is primarily seen as cosmetic. Funding has been withdrawn in many areas of the UK. 
Many of these women are suffering long term health problems and being denied treatment that would lead to a better quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
Cosmetic surgery is performed to enhance the patients appearance and this type of surgery obviously has its place. 
However, many women are being refused breast reduction on the basis that it is, primarily, acknowledged as a cosmetic procedure. 
Women are suffering chronic backache, which at times can prove crippling, neck pain, shoulder pain, headaches and breast abscesses, to name but a few ailments. 
Referrals to a surgeon are difficult, if not impossible in some areas, due to lack of funding

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.background:
This year marks 34 years since the Falklands War. 
The invasion of the Falkland Islands occurred April 2 1982. 
The conflict ended June 14 1982. 
We believe that to mark our Armed Forces bravery and sacrifice, this date should be known as Falklands Liberation Day
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the Government should mark the liberation of the Falkland Islands and name June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.
To mark our brave Armed Forces' bravery, courage and sacrifice, we believe  this should be officially recognised.
The Falklands Islands mark Margaret Thatcher Day every year. They have the right to self determination.
It is now time to mark this in our own calendar.
Make June 14th Falklands Liberation Day.

attributes.action: GAIN 'CONSUMER RIGHTS' REGARDING 'OVER PHONE' CONTRACTS FOR SMALL BUSINESSES.
attributes.background: l purchased a small pub 2 years ago to save from closure. When agreeing a Sports package over the phone I realised the next day this was not what I required. After immediate calls, letter and emails I was told I have no 14 day cooling off period, I could not cancel, and had to pay for a full year.
attributes.additional_details: Small businesses do not have the infrastructure of large companies and cannot have resources to cover all areas for contracts, accountancy, and legal complications. Specifically regarding contracts agreed over the phone where the seller could not possibly deliver all the rules and regulations of a contract, there should be 14 days allowed to consider an agreement in full. Presently an 'over the phone agreement' is irreversible and binding. Equivalence of consumer rights for Small Businesses.

attributes.action: Stop the use of the honours system being used for political gain
attributes.background: All honours to be authorised only via an independent political free board. All members of the board must be free of any political party and any person who has held political office or served in a government department to be barred from holding office on this board
attributes.additional_details: Any person is permitted to put a person forward for any honour . In doing so they must state why they believe such person deserves this award.

attributes.action: Make sign language compulsory from infants at school.
attributes.background: Anyone can become deaf in their lifetime. Surely if more people can sign language people that are deaf or people with special needs adhd or autism that use forms of signs such as makaton to communicate won't feel so isolated.
attributes.additional_details: Children are like a sponge when soaking up knowledge. So if makaton which is an easier form.of sign language is introduced to children at a young age, it would mean that we would eventually all be able to.communicate at some point in life with someone who uses sign language every day. It means future generations can go ask that child thats sat on their own in the playground to come and play with them. They will be able to.communicate, instead of not knowing how to and the child not left isolated no more.

attributes.action: Make it a law for both parents to pay equal childcare costs.
attributes.background: This petition is designed to address the re-balance required to right the injustice of one parent dis-proportionally bearing the costs of childcare in situations where parents are separated. These costs are usually excluded from maintenance agreements and unfairly burden one parent financially.
attributes.additional_details: Where parents are separated, but both work, why is it that only one of those parents has to carry the cost for childcare? The child is both parents responsibility, both parents are at work so not available to look after that child, but only one parent pays? Maintenance agreements only calculate for a child's living expenses however childcare cost are excluded but a necessity in today's society. In many ways this could be seen as a hindrance for those parents who wish to return to work.

attributes.action: Landlords must declare mortgage arrears or court proceedings related to property
attributes.background: This petition is to make it law that a landlord must declare whether there are any ongoing court proceedings in relation to the property being let (such as repossession, power of sale etc) and/or any mortgage arrears prior to a tenancy agreement being issued.
attributes.additional_details: In November 2015 I took out a 12 month assured tenancy agreement with no break clause. 4 months into the tenancy it became apparent that our landlord was in mortgage arrears prior to our tenancy, that repossession proceedings had began regarding the property and that a further court case meant that power of sale was provided to a third party to dispose of the property. As tenants we should have been made aware of these issues prior to our tenancy beginning given the complications this creates.

attributes.action: Introduce a penny tax on plastic bottles
attributes.background: Plastic bottles our damaging out health. There are toxic chemicals in plastic bottles, including polycarbonates which are linked to conditions such as cancer and an increased risk of diabetes.  Many bottles are also then polluted and ultimately damage animals and contribute to climate change.
attributes.additional_details: There are now areas of sea across the world almost entirely covered in plastics, so often the result of thoughtless pollution of materials we consume readily every day - such as plastic bottles. This pollution has done great damage to the nature and sea and wildlife in areas where currents have taken these polluted materials. A charge would go some way to encouraging less pollution and as a result, less damage to our planet's natural environments and wildlife. It is also the case that many of the chemicals contained in plastic bottles are detrimental to both human and animal health; yet we consume these goods unknowingly and without due thought.

attributes.action: Amend the Care Act (s73) 2014 which fails to protect private paying patients
attributes.background: I was booked for elective day surgery in a Private Hospital but unfortunately, the device was placed incorrectly that has resulted in horrendous physical injuries. The Private Hospital is not liable and the Surgeon denied misplacement that was not discovered until years later.
attributes.additional_details: No tests were offered to ascertain if the device was displaced as I had this surgical procedure privately. I had to vigorously research what tests were needed to identify misplacement and I eventually learnt that a volume and gadolinium MRI would be the only source. These tests were eventually done after much persistence that finally illustrated incorrect placement that has caused me physical injuries and lost career. Members of the public are under the assumption that private paying patients will always be protected but the Care Act 2014 has never protected this category of patients; this Act needs amending to ensure  all of the public are protected irrespective of fee source.

attributes.action: Provide free prescriptions for those suffering lifelong / incurable conditions
attributes.background: It is unfair that people who have no other option but to take medication for the rest of their lives, due to suffering from lifelong / incurable diseases, conditions or syndromes (such as: arthritis, asthma, heart conditions, etc.) have to pay for their prescriptions until they reach the age of 60.
attributes.additional_details:
Insulin for diabetes sufferers is free, so medication for ALL incurable diseases should also be free of charge.

Hard working tax payers who suffer from such conditions, have to pay for their prescriptions, whereas citizens on JSA can get theirs free of charge. This simply does not make sense.

£8.40 may not seem expensive, but when you are being prescribed 4 different medications per month for the same condition, this amounts to over £400 per year without a pre-paid exemption card.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy drinks to children under 18
attributes.background: The World Health Organisation carried out a review of the literature surrounding energy drinks & found most of potential health risks are related to the caffeine content. In Sweden they are restricted to being sold in pharmacies & are not sold to under 15's.
attributes.additional_details: This information came from NHS choices 2014 (warnings issued over energy drinks) They are likely to become a serious public health issue in the future if they are not more heavily regulated.

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens.
attributes.background: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens. This will allow more students to have the opportunity to get a degree and be able to apply for the best jobs.

attributes.action: Review decision-making process behind closure of nightclubs in the UK.
attributes.background: Following Islington Council's decision last night (6th September) not to renew the license for Fabric, an iconic dance music venue in London, we request that parliament reviews why decisions like this one and others are consistently being made to the detriment of dance and youth music culture.
attributes.additional_details: Fabric holds global significance for dance music, launching the careers of many artists and drawing crowds from all over world. In the last three months several other venues including The Arches, Passing Clouds and Dance Tunnel have also been forced to close. Dance music is an important part of music culture; the closure of places that grow the community, foster innovation and provide a venue to enjoy this music, will lead to the loss of the UK’s status of a breeding ground for musical talent.

attributes.action: Video all pip and esa assessments
attributes.background: There seems to be so many stories that atos, capita and other assessment companies are causing benefits to be stopped because of their lies... if they are video recorded then each party is completely backed up

attributes.action: Support Peoples QE. Reduce private debts, boost savings, rescue the economy.
attributes.background: Public and Private Debts are at an all time high in the United Kingdom.  net unsecured borrowing on credit cards and loans will rise to £662bn by the end of the decade, from £447bn in 2016. The amount of private debt is crippling the economy. We need to reduce debt in the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I am proposing that we reduce private debt through Bond given to all UK Citizens. The bond would be financed throuh QE  money created by the Bank of England. This financial value of the bond ( sat £1000 per person) would be used to either clear existing debts ( as specified) or as a savings bond for people without debt. The policy would reduce debt, increase savings, compensate savers for low interest rates reduce poverty, and help the economy to grow.

attributes.action: Stop state funded translation services in all NHS facilities.
attributes.background: The NHS spend over £23M per year on providing translation services - that's around £63,000 per day !!  That money could and should be spent on equipment/services that benefit everyone instead of a small minority.
attributes.additional_details:
Translation services that are required should be paid for by the person requiring the services, their friends, family or privately funded migrant support groups.
Implementing this change get will not only reduce expenditure on non medical NHS funding but also provide an additional incentive for migrants to learn English and assimilate into UK society.

attributes.action: Improve CAMHS services in Cumbria, especially surrounding eating disorders.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of resources and staff within Cumbria CAMHS, having just one dietitician in the entire county. The team regularly allows patients suffering from eating disorders to get so severe they require inpatient treatment hundreds of miles away.There are no specialists and a lack of care.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS stands for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, and this is where children and teenagers up to the age of 18 get support and therapy for their mental illnesses. 
There are NO specialist eating disorder services within the whole county; the closest being Middlesborough, which I am currently staying as an inpatient with severe Anorexia Nervosa for the second time due to the immense lack of support and understanding in Cumbria. This is a 2 and a half hour journey. 
This is not fair.

attributes.action: Make final UK Brexit deal subject to binding, minimum 10% majority, referendum.
attributes.background: Current Brexit discussions are largely uninformed and confused. There's no reason to think that they will not remain post Article 50 triggering. Lies, half-truths were expounded, later admitted false. EU is UK's biggest market, we need to maintain our relationship and work to reform it from inside.
attributes.additional_details: The EU non-binding referendum in June 2016 gave options to stay in / out. 29m citizens did not vote Leave. The 4% majority: Leave vs Remain actual voters is an iniquitous outcome for the majority of citizens. Many failed to understand Leave implications fully. The issue is highly political and self serving for some individuals. Our EU membership is an economic - trade issue. Key are the Single Market and Customs Union, NOT immigration. Other options exist, but unquantified, thus risky.

attributes.action: Test all children for food intolerances in primary school
attributes.background: Thousands of children are going into adulthood suffering from undiagnosed food intolerances which lead to serious auto immune diseases. With a simple finger prick blood test, we can keep them healthy and save pain, suffering and money all round.
attributes.additional_details: Auto immune diseases such as IBS, Crohns Disease, Arthritis Fibromyalgia and Celiac Disease can be caused by years of undiagnosed food intolerances, Children can also suffer permanent damage due to constant infections the body can't fight as the immune system is always on high alert against what it sees as poison. A simple test and diet change can save our children from a lifetime of pain and save the NHS an enormous amount of money

attributes.action: Give more funding into the research of mental health especially anxiety.
attributes.background: People go undiagnosed or even wrongly diagnosed with anxiety and depression every day in the UK. We need more funding into the research and better treatments. I would also like potential financial support for those with anxiety who cannot work.

attributes.action: Remove all subsidies for fossil fuels, use them to subsidise renewable energy.
attributes.background: It's impossible for the government to simultaneously state their commitment to combating climate change and subsidise fossil fuels to the extent that they do. The amount of money spent on renewable energy is meanwhile decreasing. Spending more on renewable's is the only way to show real commitment.
attributes.additional_details: Subsidies for fossil fuels which approach £6 billion a year are being given to companies which generate profits in the hundreds of millions. That money is far better used to subsidies to production and implementation of renewable energies or to subsidies the household energy bills. There is an estimated 26.7 million households in the UK, the money could be used to decrease the annual energy bill by £224. Stop giving to the rich, start giving to the people.

attributes.action: Reform the law on the defence of Insanity to benefit the mentally ill
attributes.background:
The Law Commission Report in 2013 recommended a new defence with a special verdict of "not criminally responsible by reason of a recognised medical condition".
Unfortunately this slipped through government policy making and has been ignored since.
attributes.additional_details:
The current law on insanity was made in 1848 when psychaitric illness was hardly understood. 
Despite huge developments in understanding, diagnosis  and treating mental illness, the M'Naughten Rules on insanity have remained unchanged. 
Reintroducing the proposed reform by the Law Commission would mean that people with actual medical conditions won't be excluded by the law and will stop the mentally/physically ill from pleading guilty to avoid the stigma of being classed as insane.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

attributes.action: Make statutory holiday entitlement 26 days plus bank holidays
attributes.background: Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking that the government raise statutory holiday entitlement to 26 days per year plus bank holidays (34 total) to enable working parents to cover childcare during school holidays. The legal entitlement at present is 28 days and employers can choose to have 8 of those as bank holidays.
Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.
